executive_summary: The industry has experienced increased volatility during the current period due to fluctuations in demand from industrial and construction markets. Demand from the construction market is estimated to have declined during the period, which, however, was fully offset by growth in demand from the consumer market. Demand from the industrial market has remained largely unchanged. Volatility in interest and mortgage rates, as well as changes in consumer and business confidence during the period, have been the major drivers of changing demand and profit during the period. Additionally, pandemic-driven supply chain disruptions contributed to elevated price volatility for industry products. Overall, industry revenue is projected to stagnate during the period, with revenue remaining at slightly less than $3.0 billion.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pottery, Ceramics and Plumbing Fixture Prices Experienced Historically High Volatility During the Period, Driven Largely by the Federal Reserve's Monetary Policy and Supply Chain Disruptions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Prices for pottery, ceramics and plumbing fixtures historically grew at approximately 2% annually, which generally aligns with inflation growth. While the economy-wide inflation was only 6.5% in 2022, prices for pottery, ceramics and plumbing fixture climbed by nearly 19%, contributing to inflation-adjusted 8.8% industry growth in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for Pottery, Ceramics and Plumbing Fixture Has Been Heavily Impacted by Pandemic-Driven Industrial Production and Construction Trends
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry revenue experienced a substantial decline in 2020, following the outbreak of COVID-19, resulting from lower demand for wet and dry process voltage porcelain products and related components typically used in industrial settings, as industrial production plummeted in 2020. A decline in private nonresidential construction also contributed to lower industry revenue in 2020 although being largely offset by growth in residential construction which was fueled by historically low mortgage rates through 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: M E X I C O  H A S  T A K E N  A D V A N T A G E  O F  T H E  O N G O I N G  T R A D E T E N S I O N S  B E T W E E N  T H E  U S  A N D  C H I N A
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry trade with Mexico accounts for approximately one-fifth of domestic demand and one-fifth of exports' share of industry revenue, representing an increase during the period. Relatively low labor costs and geographic proximity make Mexico one of the most important trade partners in the industry, further supported by the United States-Mexico-Canada agreement, which entered into force on July 1, 2020.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: D E M A N D  F O R  P O T T E R Y ,  C E R A M I C S  A N D  P L U M B I N G  F I X T U R E  I S E X P E C T E D  T O  I N C R E A S E  D R I V E N  B Y  P R O J E C T E D  D E C L I N E D  I N I N T E R E S T  R A T E S  A N D  G R O W I N G  C O N S T R U C T I O N  M A R K E T S
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for pottery, ceramics and plumbing fixture is expected to grow, driven by overall economic growth as the Federal Reserve reduces interest rates in the first half of the outlook period, stimulating construction and industrial activities.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Domestic Manufacturers are Expected to Benefit From Growing Demand From Foreign Markets, Although Competition is Projected to Intensify Domestically
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The projections are predicated on flat inflation-adjusted prices for pottery, ceramics and plumbing fixture, with revenue growth expected to be driven by growing demand rather than price increases. A portion of industry growth will be driven by growing demand from foreign markets, fueled by projected depreciation in the US dollar. As the US dollar depreciates, US-manufactured goods will become relatively less expensive overseas, stimulating demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Advancements in Materials and Digital Manufacturing Technologies Will Support Industry Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Innovations in ceramic materials are expected to involve the development of new formulations with improved properties such as enhanced strength, durability and aesthetic appeal, benefiting the industry. The adoption of digital design and manufacturing technologies, such as computer-aided design, computer-aided manufacturing and additive manufacturing, will enable greater customization, efficiency and product innovation.

industry_definition: This industry includes establishments that primarily manufacture advanced ceramic materials and components, pottery and plumbing fixtures made of clay or other ceramic materials. This industry does not include companies.
key_trends: Manufacturers compete on various factors, including price and quality. Competition varies based on the different product segments offered by the industry.
Imports satisfy a significant portion of domestic demand. Most imports of industry products come from low-cost-producing countries like China and Mexico.
Ongoing US-China trade tensions have reshaped trade dynamics, elevating Mexico as a key industry partner, supported by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement.
The pandemic has contributed to increased volatility during the period, with the industry experiencing the impact of volatility in consumer spending, industrial production and construction activity.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand has been impacted by volatility in mortgage rates and pandemic-induced shifts in work patterns. Growth in construction projects, housing starts, and renovation activities spurs demand as these are essential components.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Mexico has Capitalized on the Trade Tensions Between the US and China
international_trade_points.trade_description: Industry trade with Mexico now makes up around 20% of domestic demand, showing growth over time due to Mexico's low labor costs and proximity.

international_trade_points.trade_title: China's Historically High Share of Industry Imports is Driven by Low Labor Costs and Established Reputation
international_trade_points.trade_description: Pottery and ceramics in the US are frequently imported from China due to lower production costs and China's large, established ceramics industry.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Although Canada and Mexico are the Two Main Foreign Markets, Industry Products are Exported to a Variety of Foreign Markets
international_trade_points.trade_description: While Canada and Mexico are the primary foreign markets, the industry exports to diverse global destinations like Germany, China, South Korea and Malaysia.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Projected Depreciation in the US Dollar is Expected to Benefit the Industry via Higher Demand from Foreign Markets
international_trade_points.trade_description: As the US dollar weakens, exports will become more competitively priced internationally, contributing to revenue growth, though import penetration will remain high.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Clean Air Act is crucial for ceramics manufacturers, especially when it comes to controlling emissions from kilns and other processing equipment. The EPA mandates limits on hazardous air pollutants (HAPs), requiring compliance with emissions standards.
This federal act governs how ceramics manufacturers must handle, store and dispose of hazardous waste materials, such as used solvents and discarded ceramic residues.
Under TSCA, manufacturers must report new chemical substances intended for use in their processes prior to production or importation.

FAQs.question: How have imports from low-wage countries like China and Mexico impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Imports from low-wage countries like China and Mexico have increased competition and have placed pressure on domestic operations to keep costs low while maintaining quality and service standards.

FAQs.question: Has the pandemic impacted imports?
FAQs.answer: The pandemic has disrupted global supply chains, leading to shortages and delays in imports, which has further impacted operations.

FAQs.question: What are some benefits of joining industry consortiums?
FAQs.answer: Joining industry consortiums can provide ceramics manufacturers access to pooled resources and shared research.

FAQs.question: How can corporate research partnerships benefit ceramics manufacturers?
FAQs.answer: Many ceramics manufacturers benefit from partnerships with larger corporations that have vested interests in the development of advanced ceramic materials and products.

FAQs.question: What is the focus of major players in the ceramics industry?
FAQs.answer: Although many of the major players do have an expanded portfolio that includes other materials, they concentrate on one area of ceramics.

FAQs.question: How are companies responding to pressure from imports?
FAQs.answer: Due to the pressure from imports, companies are searching for ways to stay competitive and cut costs to keep the product affordable.
